Holiday Money Get in touch Book a video call Make an enquiry Call 0800 713 715 Help Get in touch Back View gallery / Back Berg Barn Hill CR Crikey Campers Interior Safari Camper CR Crikey Campers Safari Camper CR Crikey Campers Interior Bedding Safari Camper CR Crikey Camper Exterior Awning Safari Camper CR Crikey Campers Kitchen Safari Camper CR Crikey Campers Western Australia 21 Day Broome to Darwin 4WD Safari Camper Self Drive 21 Day 4WD Safari Camper Hire Overview Inclusions Terms & Conditions Take the ultimate Aussie road trip with this 21-day 4WD adventure from Broome to Darwin. Travelling at a comfortable pace, you'll have time to truly soak up the Kimberley's rugged beauty and the Top End's lush national parks. Discover dramatic gorges, remote cattle stations, cascading waterfalls, and ancient Aboriginal rock art as you journey the full length of the iconic Gibb River Road. With your fully equipped 4WD and camper trailer, you’ll have the freedom to explore off the beaten track, stay longer at your favourite spots, and enjoy the wild north your way—no rush, no crowds, just pure outback magic. View more View less 21 Day 4WD Safari Camper Hire from $ 12,489 per person share twin. Flights are additional Enquire now Sale Period : until 08 Sep 25 or unless sold out prior Your inclusions 21 Day 4WD Tow Vehicle and Off Road Safari Camper Hire - Sleeping up to 4 people Pick up Broome, Drop off Darwin Unlimited Kilometres Mid liability reduction insurance Bedding and Linen Starlink Internet Packages are available for hire periods of min 14 days at an additional cost of AUD$15 per day Excludes All National Park and Campground Fees Price from From $12,489 per hire (max 4 people) Travel: 30 May-28 Aug 26 21 Day Broome to Darwin via the Gibb River Road Suggested Itinerary Day 1: Arrive in Perth Pick up your 4WD and camper trailer Explore Broome: Cable Beach, Chinatown, Matso’s Brewery Overnight: Broome Day 2: Broome to Derby Drive to Derby via the Boab Prison Tree Stock up on supplies and prepare to hit the Gibb Overnight: Derby or Windjana Gorge Day 3: Windjana Gorge & Tunnel Creek Walk through the gorge and spot freshwater crocs Explore the historic Tunnel Creek cave system Overnight: Windjana Gorge campground Day 4: Bell Gorge One of the most photogenic gorges on the Gibb Swim in plunge pools, relax on red rock ledges Overnight: Silent Grove or Bell Gorge campground Day 5: Relax or Detour to Lennard Gorge Option to rest, hike further, or detour to Lennard Gorge Overnight: Bell Gorge area Day 6: Adcock & Galvans Gorge Short walks to shaded pools and rock art Overnight: Manning Gorge campground Day 7: Manning Gorge Full day to hike, swim and explore Optional: Manning Falls hike Overnight: Manning Gorge Day 8: Mt Barnett Roadhouse to Drysdale Station Stock up at the roadhouse Head north on the Kalumburu Road Overnight: Drysdale River Station Day 9: Optional Day Trip to Mitchell Falls (scenic flight or 4WD) Bucket-list waterfalls, Aboriginal art, helicopter return Overnight: Drysdale or Mitchell Plateau area Day 10: Ellenbrae Station Stop for scones and a swim in a waterhole Overnight: Ellenbrae Station Day 11: Home Valley Station Iconic station stay with dramatic Cockburn Ranges views Overnight: Home Valley Day 12: El Questro Wilderness Park Drive the Pentecost River crossing Arrive at El Questro, settle in Overnight: El Questro Day 13: El Questro Gorges & Springs Hike Emma Gorge, relax in Zebedee Springs Overnight: El Questro Day 14: El Questro Leisure Day Optional horse rides, cruises or hikes Overnight: El Questro Day 15: Kununurra Explore Mirima National Park, local markets, and galleries Overnight: Kununurra Day 16: Lake Argyle Swim in the infinity pool, optional sunset cruise Overnight: Lake Argyle Day 17: Into the NT: Drive to Katherine Long drive day via Victoria River and Gregory National Park Overnight: Katherine Day 18: Nitmiluk (Katherine Gorge) Cruise the gorge, kayak or hike lookout trails Overnight: Katherine or Edith Falls Day 19: Leliyn / Edith Falls Spend the day swimming and hiking Overnight: Edith Falls Day 20: Litchfield National Park Spend the day swimming and hiking Overnight: Edith Falls Day 21: Arrive in Darwin Explore the city, waterfront precinct or Mindil Markets Drop off vehicle & reflect on your epic adventure Iconic Gibb River Road, with time to explore at your own pace Remote station stays and outback hospitality El Questro, Lake Argyle, Nitmiluk and Litchfield National Parks Mitchell Falls (optional), waterfalls galore, Aboriginal rock art A genuine off-the-grid Aussie experience Terms & Conditions Valid for new bookings to 31 Oct 25 or until sold out • Prices are correct as at 17 Jul 25 • Prices are thereafter subject to change without notice until time of confirmation • Blackout dates and surcharges may apply over special events, public holidays, and holiday periods • 4WD Safari Camper Hire is based on a minimum 21 day hire, pick up Broome and drop off Darwin. Hire is based on ‘per calendar day’ or part thereof basis. Equipment is available for pick up on the first day of hire from 9.00am and must be returned by 4.00pm on the last day of hire, unless by mutual agreement. Starlink Internet Packages are available for hire periods of min 14 days at an additional cost of AUD$15 per day. Child Car Seat – Free of charge for hires 14 days or more. Linen – Free of charge for hires 14 days or more. Hire is based on a max 4 people. Hire includes unlimited KM’s and mid liability reduction insurance option. All Hirers are subject to payment of a Security Bond, payment and cancellation fees apply and will be advised at time of booking. • Inclusions are subject to change based on supplier operational capabilities • Flights are additional Prices may vary due to a number of factors including tax and surcharge increases, exchange rate movements and availability • Min/max stays apply • Any hotel credits that are unused are not refundable, transferable & can’t be exchanged for cash • Advertised price is based on per hire and max 4 people. Credit card fees will apply • Amendment and cancellation fees apply • Accommodation ratings are based on House of Travel ratings and are a guide only to the overall quality of the property • Packages are subject to availability • Product is supplied by reputable suppliers with their own terms and conditions • Please ask your House of Travel consultant for full details.
